Articles.Content:
Hey guys, I was cleaning out my screenshot folder earlier and I was just reminiscing over some old photos. For whatever reason, this one just happened to catch my eye. I guess I haven't taken care of them as well as I should have, so some of you might just dismiss this as some dust or a scratch or whatever, but I think its a little too odd to not share with the community.

I blew up the suspect part of the photo. You can clearly see two foreign objects there. I did some color and levels editing on the left to try and rule out being scratches. I guess its suspect but I don't think they are, there are clearly two objects visible in what seems like a low Munar orbit. I thought they might be stars but because of the lighting here, the starfield isn't even visible, and there aren't any planets or bright stars in that direction. And just to rule it out, no I don't have anything else orbiting the Mun. The closest I can figure is maybe it's an asteroid, but two close together like that?

Anyways, I just wanted to share my anomaly with you guys. Anyone else see anything weird out there?

Perhaps the Munar arch?

i'm more interested in the red thingys.
swamp gas caught in the light of venus, that's all. now look at this flashy thing in my hand.
Aren't they -- ah -- stars? They look like bright stars to me.
Haha...laughing so hard...lol. Obviously aliens, but seriously, this might be a nice idea for a written fanwork, since it's pretty creative

Aren't they -- ah -- stars? They look like bright stars to me.

I mean, I guess it could be. I've been looking at my other pictures so it's easier for me to think otherwise. The problem is there isn't really anything all that bright in that direction, the majority of bright stars and/or planets are along the galactic plane. The station is oriented with the left side facing 'up' in the first photo, so the area in question is too low, there are a few bright stars but you can only just barely see them without being on the dark side. I don't usually shoot photos there because its hard to see (as if this is much better ). Besides, they'd show up in other photos and I can't seem to find them anywhere else.

Edited April 9, 2014 by Hyomoto

Haha...laughing so hard...lol. Obviously aliens, but seriously, this might be a nice idea for a written fanwork, since it's pretty creative

I'll get started on one.

Called "Project Navy Journal", it will document the secret research by the Kerbal Military and Space Program into paranormal sightings of spacecraft and aero craft that do not exist in official records. It will also deal with paranormal investigators and researchers projects and experiences.
The cause of everything unknown...
